H0.text: in what part of the digestive tube do you expect the initial digestion of starch. The Esophagus

H1.text: in what part of the digestive tube do you expect the initial digestion of starch. The Stomach

H2.text: in what part of the digestive tube do you expect the initial digestion of starch. The Duodenum

H3.text: in what part of the digestive tube do you expect the initial digestion of starch. the mouth

A4.text: Saliva, a liquid secreted by the salivary glands, contains salivary amylase, an enzyme which starts the digestion of starch in the food.

A5.text: About 30% of starch is hydrolyzed into disaccharide in the oral cavity (mouth).
